hero.subtitle: When AI codes faster than you can specify, your methodology must evolve. MADD guarantees zero drift between intention and implementation.

problem.title:
AI-assisted development changes everything,
except our methodologies.
problem.card1_text: AI produces code that seems correct but subtly deviates from your intention. Without knowing it, you accumulate invisible technical debt.
problem.card2_text: The agent says "done" but left TODOs, partial implementations, ignored edge cases. The code passes tests but doesn't solve the problem.
problem.card3_text: Each session starts from scratch. Architectural decisions get lost. Conventions erode. The project becomes an incoherent patchwork.
problem.card4_text: The agent that generates the code is the same one that documents it. It's the fox guarding the henhouse. Self-evaluation masks problems.

principles.title: 6 Principles for Zero Drift
principles.p1_text: Intention is not a forgotten conversation. It's a versioned, structured document that answers "why" and "what" before any "how".
principles.p1_change: → Before generating code, intention must be formalized and validated.
principles.p2_text: A specification that can't be automatically verified isn't a contract, it's a wish. Every requirement has automatable validation criteria.
principles.p2_change: → Tests, assertions, schemas: the contract verifies itself.
principles.p3_title: No agent validates its own work
principles.p3_text: An agent that generates code cannot be the source of truth on that code's quality. Validation must always come from an agent that didn't participate in production.
principles.p4_text: What was actually implemented must be documented objectively, independently of what the development agent claims to have done.
principles.p4_change: → An independent Scribe agent analyzes the code and produces the truth.
principles.p5_text: When marginal development cost decreases, investing in architecture becomes rational. We prioritize what de-risks what comes next.
principles.p5_change: → Sequencing favors solidity, not immediate impressions.
principles.p6_text: AI has outdated training data. Skills inject up-to-date knowledge and define quality criteria between phases.
principles.p6_change: → Each transition is mediated by an explicit skill.

agents.title: 4 Agents, Zero Conflict of Interest
agents.subtitle: Each agent has a unique role. None validates its own work.
agents.spec_desc: The Intention Architect. Formalizes the "why" and the "what".
agents.dev_desc: The Developer. Transforms intention into code.

quickstart.title: Getting Started with MADD
quickstart.solo_step1_text: Use 2-3 different models: Gemini for specs, Claude for dev, GPT for audit. Never let an agent validate its own work.
quickstart.solo_step2_text: Before each dev session, write an Intention Document: why, what, success criteria. This is your contract.
quickstart.solo_step3_text: Pass the produced code to your audit agent with a due diligence skill. Never merge without independent audit.
quickstart.solo_step4_text: A 4th agent (or you) analyzes what was actually implemented and updates the documentation. This is your project memory.
quickstart.team_step1_text: Intention Architect (PM/PO), Agent Orchestrator (senior dev), Alignment Arbiter (QA or peer). Each role is responsible for a phase.
quickstart.team_step2_text: A shared repo with all skills: Spec Skill, Dev Skill, Audit Skill, Retro-Spec Skill. Versioned like code.
quickstart.team_step3_text: The retro-specification is shared and updated each cycle. It's the starting point for every new iteration.
quickstart.migration_step1_text: No more fixed duration. A cycle starts when an intention is formalized and ends when the retro-spec is validated.
quickstart.migration_step2_text: Each story becomes an Intention Document with executable validation criteria. No more "looks good to me".
quickstart.migration_step3_text: The DoD becomes a formal skill that the audit agent executes. Verifiable, reproducible, non-negotiable.
quickstart.migration_step4_text: No more "how to improve the process". We consolidate retro-specs and improve skills.

concepts.page_intro: Three artifacts structure every MADD cycle: the Intention Document, the Executable Contract, and the Retro-Specification.
concepts.intention_intro: The entry artifact. The starting point of every MADD cycle.
concepts.intention_questions: The Intention Document answers three fundamental questions:
concepts.intention_q1: Why? — The business context, the problem to solve
concepts.intention_q2: What? — What needs to be delivered, expected features
concepts.intention_q3: How to know if it's successful? — Measurable validation criteria
concepts.intention_practice1: One Intention Document = one coherent unit of work
concepts.intention_practice2: Each requirement must have at least one validation criterion
concepts.intention_practice3: The "out of scope" is as important as the scope
concepts.intention_practice4: The Intention Document is versioned with the code
concepts.contract_intro: The validation artifact. What transforms a wish into a verifiable commitment.
concepts.contract_desc: A contract is "executable" when it can be verified automatically. No "looks good" — it either passes or fails.
concepts.contract_type1_desc: Verify the behavior of isolated functions
concepts.contract_principle: If you can't write a test to verify a requirement, that requirement is poorly defined.
concepts.contract_flow: The executable contract is produced by the Spec Agent along with the Intention Document. The Dev Agent implements to satisfy the contract. The Audit Agent verifies contract compliance.
concepts.retrospec_intro: The memory artifact. What objectively documents what actually exists.
concepts.retrospec_desc: The retro-spec is not what the developer says they did. It's what an independent agent (the Scribe) observes by analyzing the code.
concepts.retrospec_content1: Current state: What exists in the code
concepts.retrospec_usage: The retro-spec becomes the starting point for the next cycle. When new development begins, the Spec Agent consults the retro-spec to understand the real system state — not the marketing documentation.
concepts.cycle_intro: The three artifacts form a virtuous cycle:
concepts.cycle_step1: Intention → Contract: The Spec Agent formalizes the need and defines success criteria
concepts.cycle_step2: Contract → Code: The Dev Agent implements to satisfy the contract
concepts.cycle_step3: Code → Audit: The Audit Agent verifies alignment
concepts.cycle_step4: Code → Retro-Spec: The Scribe Agent documents reality
concepts.cycle_step5: Retro-Spec → Intention: The next cycle starts from documented reality
concepts.cycle_conclusion: Zero drift = each cycle is anchored in the previous one's reality.
concepts.cta_text: Discover the Skills that orchestrate these concepts.

skills.page_intro: Skills inject up-to-date knowledge and define quality criteria between agents. Each transition is mediated by an explicit skill.
skills.why_intro: AI models have training data that may be outdated. They don't know:
skills.why_conclusion: Skills bridge this gap. They are structured documents that inject missing context and define the rules of the game.
skills.spec_skill_desc: Guides the production of structured Intention Documents with verifiable requirements.
skills.dev_skill_desc: Defines conventions, patterns, and constraints that the implementation must respect.
skills.audit_skill_desc: Lists validation criteria, patterns to detect, report format.
skills.retrospec_skill_desc: Guides objective code analysis and factual documentation production.
skills.correction_skill_desc: Frames finding corrections with mandatory traceability.
skills.custom_intro: The provided skills are templates. Adapt them to your context:
skills.custom_step1: Identify friction points — Where does the agent regularly make mistakes?
skills.custom_step2: Document missing knowledge — What doesn't it know?
skills.custom_step3: Structure as rules — No prose, clear directives
skills.custom_step4: Test and iterate — A skill evolves with the project
skills.custom_conclusion: Version your skills like code. They are part of the project's living documentation.
skills.cta_text: Start with the Specification Skill and Development Skill. The others will follow naturally.

manifesto.page_intro: Multi-Agent Driven Development — The methodology that guarantees zero drift between intention and implementation.
manifesto.context_intro: AI-assisted development changes everything, except our methodologies.
manifesto.context_p1: Scrum, Kanban, SAFe were designed to manage the scarcity of development time. When a team of 10 people took a year to deliver a platform, planning, prioritizing, and coordinating were necessary.
manifesto.context_p2: Today, a developer with the right AI tools delivers in 2 days what used to take 12 months.
manifesto.context_bottleneck: Development time is no longer the bottleneck.
manifesto.context_risk1: Silent drift between intention and implementation
manifesto.context_conclusion: MADD is a methodology designed for these new challenges.
manifesto.p1_text: Intention is not a forgotten conversation. It's a versioned, structured document that answers "why" and "what" before any "how".
manifesto.p1_change: What this changes: Before generating code, intention must be formalized and validated.
manifesto.p2_text: A specification that can't be automatically verified isn't a contract, it's a wish.
manifesto.p2_change: What this changes: Every requirement has automatable validation criteria (tests, assertions, schemas).
manifesto.p3_title: 3. No agent validates its own work
manifesto.p3_text: An agent that generates code cannot be the source of truth on that code's quality. Validation must always come from an agent that didn't participate in production.
manifesto.p3_change: What this changes: Mandatory architecture with 4 minimum roles — Intention, Development, Audit, Retro-Specification.
manifesto.p4_text: What was actually implemented must be documented objectively, independently of what the development agent claims to have done.
manifesto.p4_change: What this changes: An independent Scribe agent analyzes the code and produces documentation of what actually exists.
manifesto.p5_text: When marginal development cost decreases, investing in architecture becomes rational. We no longer prioritize by "immediate business value" but by "foundation solidity".
manifesto.p5_change: What this changes: Sequencing favors what de-risks what comes next, not what impresses stakeholders.
manifesto.p6_text: AI has potentially outdated training data. Skills inject up-to-date knowledge (documentation, conventions, patterns) and define quality criteria between phases.
manifesto.p6_change: What this changes: Each transition (Intention→Dev, Dev→Audit, etc.) is mediated by an explicit skill.
manifesto.not1_right: MADD requires verifiable contracts, not vague prompts
manifesto.not2_right: MADD is open source, no training business
manifesto.not3_right: MADD repositions humans as intention architects
manifesto.not4_right: MADD defines principles, not mandatory ceremonies
manifesto.not5_right: MADD adapts: solo, team, PO, dev, everyone can practice
manifesto.agents_intro: MADD architecture relies on strict separation of responsibilities. Each agent has a unique role and never validates its own work.
manifesto.agent_spec_desc: Formalizes the "why" and "what". Produces the Intention Document and defines the executable contract with its validation criteria.
manifesto.agent_dev_desc: Transforms intention into code. Respects the contract, implements features, documents technical choices.
manifesto.agent_audit_desc: Audits without complacency. Analyzes produced code, verifies alignment with intention, identifies drifts and risks.
manifesto.agent_scribe_desc: Documents objective reality. Analyzes what actually exists in the code (not what the dev claims), compares with specs, produces the retro-specification.
manifesto.agents_principle: Fundamental principle: The Scribe didn't participate in development. Their retro-specification is objective because they have no interest in embellishing or minimizing.
manifesto.skills_intro: Skills are knowledge contracts that mediate each transition between agents.
manifesto.skill_spec_desc: Guides the Spec Agent in producing structured Intention Documents with verifiable requirements.
manifesto.skill_dev_desc: Defines conventions, patterns, and constraints that the Dev Agent must respect.
manifesto.skill_audit_desc: Lists validation criteria, patterns to detect, audit report format.
manifesto.skill_retrospec_desc: Guides the Scribe in objective code analysis and production of documentation of what actually exists.
manifesto.skill_correction_desc: Frames audit finding corrections with mandatory traceability.
manifesto.skills_versioning: Skills are versioned and evolve with the project. They can be public (framework documentation), project (internal conventions), or delta (temporary knowledge patches).
manifesto.start_solo1: Use 2-3 different models/agents for roles (e.g.: Gemini for specs, Claude for dev, GPT for audit)
manifesto.start_team1: Assign roles: Intention Architect, Orchestrator, Arbiter
manifesto.start_team2: Centralize skills in a shared repo
manifesto.start_team3: Shared retro-spec as source of truth
manifesto.start_scrum3: Definition of Done becomes the Audit Skill
manifesto.contribute_intro: MADD is open source. The methodology evolves through community contributions.
manifesto.contribute_github: GitHub: Propose improvements to principles, skills, documentation
manifesto.contribute_no_cert: No certification. No paid training. No commercial distortion.
manifesto.cta_text: Help define the future of AI-assisted development.
